participating-org.narrative: AENA Associacao Nacional de Extensao Rur

AENA is a grass rooted organization, with high potential of creating impact due its knowledge of operating in local context. History AENA was founded in 2004 , and in 2006 was recognized as a legal institution. It was registered at the Registries of Nampula under No. 58, sheets 30of the book G- 1 since July 30, 2007 . The motivation for the creation of AENA , is the fact that despite much effort to reduce rural poverty still prevalent problems of social, economic and cultural development of rural communities , especially food and nutritional insecurity, widespread illiteracy, weak citizenship , poor management and unsustainable natural resource governance, gender inequality and no respect for the environment .
Currently has 36 members and is headquartered in the city of Nampula
Overall objective Contribute to the improvement of living standards of rural communities by encouraging local initiatives and promoting sustainable management and governance of natural resources in rural communities.
Specific Strategic Objectives 1. Promote food security, economic and Nutrition ; 2 . Equity and gender equality; 3 . Advocacy and lobbying on Natural Resources and extension ; 4 . Organizational Development geographic Location Headquarters : Nampula City It has activities in three provinces , namely: Districts of Nampula Meconta , Monapo Mogicual , Angoche and Moma - in the districts of Zambezia Pebane , Gile and Ile and Cabo Delgado - Districts Montepuez , Coin and Mocímboa Beach
Member Networks # NB Provincial Agriculture Network and the SC / SC Platform Nampula ; # CIP , and EITI National Platform ; # Academic City in Nampula interested in the management and sustainable governance of NB ;
Actual Partners Sponsors: 1. DANIDA through the Royal Danish Embassy 2 . CARE International 3 . Swedish Cooperative Centre Programthrough the ACT

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
